commit_message:
All workflow view miss url for a cancel action

All WorkflowView miss url for a cancel action, But all FormView has.
This patch add the cancel action fot WorkflowView as FormView.

Change-Id: Ic3cc643e8c5803b3887c4e4ef54d8f73d9b78d65
Closes-Bug: #1481622
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/86/209386/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. attribute: cancel_url (optional) The url for a cancel action. This url defaults to the success_url if omitted. Note that the cancel_url redirect is nullified when shown in a modal dialog. cancel_url = None def get_cancel_url(self): workflow = self.get_workflow() return self.cancel_url or workflow.get_success_url() context['cancel_url'] = self.get_cancel_url()

commit_message:
Logout url is hard coded

This patch uses the LOGOUT_URL config value instead of the
hard-coded value. This error occurs when angular receives a
401 response and attempts to log out the user.

Closes-bug: #1444725

Change-Id: I6e29766e2a99ed809b9306e8b1c9e6d412922989

commit_message:
Remove N1K profile support

The Cisco N1K profile code is being moved out of the Horizon master
repo and into the horizon-cisco-ui repo. This is part of that
vendor decomposition.
Removing the profile support code from the networks panel of the
projects dashboard. Also removing supporting unit test code.

Change-Id: I99521554ede85ca831c4c47e87241f795636e708
Partially-Implements: blueprint horizon-vendor-split
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/39/215239/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: Refactor network topology graph as an Angular directive
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-07-07 11:56:06.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/810319fe1f0811620391a09eea541665f3bc72a0', 'message': "Refactor network topology graph as an Angular directive

Separate network topology graph into reusable part and
network-specific part. Reusable part which is implemented as
<topology-graph> directive

* takes care of initial rendering according to the data provided in
  '=data' attribute;
* re-renders its contents each time '=data' changes on scope;
* provides one-level grouping via using convex hulls and 'contains'
  array on each node that contains sub-nodes;
* exposes an API via controller which is used for customizing reusable
  graph - i.e., specific node glyphs, sizes, affinities, callbacks
  etc.

All the specific network code is placed into network topology controller, including:

* initial data transformations, i.e. marking different nodes with
  different types (server/network/ext-network/router) which works in
  conjunction with <config-topology-node> directive provided for graph
  customization;
* all the legacy code related to pop-ups creation and behavior (copied
  from networktopology.js as is: what worked there still works here,
  what was broken still is broken).

Most significant changes to the original curvature topology graph code:

* simplified data containers (no usage of function constructors,
  'type' key on a an object for type-checking).
* refactored group collapse & expand logic: more intensive use of
  d3.js data joins, all the node hidden in a collapsed group are moved
  to a separate $hiddenNodes array, and put back to $nodes once the
  group is expanded - with d3.js handling re-rendering of this stuff
  for us in a $drawGraph method. The same applies to redrawing the
  links of hidden nodes.
* refactored type-dispatched rendering of nodes in $drawGraph to make
  them use type-specific attributes (in situation when specific types
  and stylings are not known in advance) - by using
  d3.selection.filter function.

This commit is just a first step in angularizing the topology
graph. I merely claim that the current refactoring didn't break a lot
of things, i.e. the things that worked before in network topology
still work :). Among other features/fixes that are yet to be done are:

* add tests and documentation
* ensure that the proposed level of directive abstraction works for at
  least 2 more consumers (e.g., Workbook graph for Mistral Workbook
  Builder, HOT Template graph for Hot Builder, possible stack topology
  for an existing Heat stack).

Implements: blueprint curvature-network-topology
Change-Id: I688f48eddcb8f22a240a94913e8879cb1332c388

commit_message:
Refactor network topology graph as an Angular directive

Separate network topology graph into reusable part and
network-specific part. Reusable part which is implemented as
<topology-graph> directive

* takes care of initial rendering according to the data provided in
  '=data' attribute;
* re-renders its contents each time '=data' changes on scope;
* provides one-level grouping via using convex hulls and 'contains'
  array on each node that contains sub-nodes;
* exposes an API via controller which is used for customizing reusable
  graph - i.e., specific node glyphs, sizes, affinities, callbacks
  etc.

All the specific network code is placed into network topology controller, including:

* initial data transformations, i.e. marking different nodes with
  different types (server/network/ext-network/router) which works in
  conjunction with <config-topology-node> directive provided for graph
  customization;
* all the legacy code related to pop-ups creation and behavior (copied
  from networktopology.js as is: what worked there still works here,
  what was broken still is broken).

Most significant changes to the original curvature topology graph code:

* simplified data containers (no usage of function constructors,
  'type' key on a an object for type-checking).
* refactored group collapse & expand logic: more intensive use of
  d3.js data joins, all the node hidden in a collapsed group are moved
  to a separate $hiddenNodes array, and put back to $nodes once the
  group is expanded - with d3.js handling re-rendering of this stuff
  for us in a $drawGraph method. The same applies to redrawing the
  links of hidden nodes.
* refactored type-dispatched rendering of nodes in $drawGraph to make
  them use type-specific attributes (in situation when specific types
  and stylings are not known in advance) - by using
  d3.selection.filter function.

This commit is just a first step in angularizing the topology
graph. I merely claim that the current refactoring didn't break a lot
of things, i.e. the things that worked before in network topology
still work :). Among other features/fixes that are yet to be done are:

* add tests and documentation
* make the code adhere to JP styleguide
* ensure that the proposed level of directive abstraction works for at
  least 2 more consumers (e.g., Workbook graph for Mistral Workbook
  Builder, HOT Template graph for Hot Builder, possible stack topology
  for an existing Heat stack).

One more remark: this commit mostly adds new lines (despite it's a
refactoring) because I didn't touch horizon.networktopology.js
original file. Once it's clear that nothing of original functionality
was lost, I'll remove it.

Implements: blueprint curvature-network-topology
Change-Id: I688f48eddcb8f22a240a94913e8879cb1332c388

commit_message:
Consider the actual quantity of available FIPs in AllocateFIP Form

In case the number of FIP that could be actually allocated in the
selected network is less than the Quota for the given User in a given
Project, use that number instead of Quota value.

Progress bar update in case of pool change is yet to be implemented.

Closes-Bug: #1431480
Change-Id: I3810cef32bc9c707a301938b3adabff6e5d3e3c3

subject: Ensure unicode and non-unicode don't mix in interpolations
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-08 11:55:08.000000000', 'files': ['horizon/tables/actions.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/a32ff9c44c7e3884a01cfb0c80cb8a644938d79f', 'message': "Ensure unicode and non-unicode don't mix in interpolations

To be 100% safe here we need to know that both interpolation template
and its arguments are of the same type (unicode or non-unicode). This
rule can be weakened to some degree if one of the strings doesn't have
non-latin characters (so the utf-8 representation can be decoded even
with ascii codec), but relying on it is prone to errors.  If we're to
stick to u'' for interpolation templates, we need also ensure that
every possible argument to it also is of unicode type.

Change-Id: I145d70f7d4bbd08425e85f3f571db546a72973eb
"}]
commit_message:
Ensure unicode and non-unicode don't mix in interpolations

To be 100% safe here we need to know that both interpolation template
and its arguments are of the same type (unicode or non-unicode). This
rule can be weakened to some degree if one of the strings doesn't have
non-latin characters (so the utf-8 representation can be decoded even
with ascii codec), but relying on it is prone to errors.  If we're to
stick to u'' for interpolation templates, we need also ensure that
every possible argument to it also is of unicode type.

Change-Id: I145d70f7d4bbd08425e85f3f571db546a72973eb

commit_message:
Hide panels without services

Horizon attempts to show several panels when the relevant service
isn't available: Admin/Overview, Metadata defintions;
Project/Overview, Access + Security

This patch hides those panels if the needed service isn't available
and handles secondary issues of logging in with an inaccessible
default panel and not showing empty dashboards

Change-Id: Ic31a81f7263dcc8c30dd1f3d0d675e809a2ae240
Closes-bug: #1431407

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-01-29 05:51:56.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/6ee992cfd183af0252144f2e6c7b62fd03337056', 'message': "angularJS workflow for launching heat stacks

  - replaces django multi-step form view with angular wizard
  - allows for multiple file uploads, client side file downloads
    etc. Fixes issues with file locations & environment files
  - removes support for URL template files
  - requires a custom heatclient from here:
      o https://github.com/jsomara/python-heatclient/tree/envfiles
    if this becomes a blocking issue, we can add that method to horizon
    temporarily. The other possibility is that it is extended to support
    nested stacks as well (a Juno goal). This patch includes this code
    inside horizon, with the intention of removing it when support becomes
    available in upstream python-heatclient
  - there are outstanding messaging improvements (error messages, etc) that
    this patch could take advantage of for better message dialogs

To test this, check out sample environment & template files here. You'll
notice that the referenced file in the environment will get added in
stage2 of the wizard. If you don't have any file references to resolve,
it will go straight to stage3.
- https://github.com/hardys/demo_templates/blob/master/juno_summit_intro_to_heat/example2_server_with_volume_nested/server_with_volume.yaml
- https://github.com/hardys/demo_templates/blob/master/juno_summit_intro_to_heat/example4_provider_environment/env_server_with_volume.yaml
- https://github.com/hardys/demo_templates/blob/master/juno_summit_intro_to_heat/example4_provider_environment/server_with_volume_env.yaml

Closes-Bug: #1322258
Partial-Implements:
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/horizon/+spec/heat-nested-stack

commit_message:
angularJS workflow for launching heat stacks

  - replaces django multi-step form view with angular wizard
  - allows for multiple file uploads, client side file downloads
    etc. Fixes issues with file locations & environment files
  - removes support for URL template files
  - requires a custom heatclient from here:
      o https://github.com/jsomara/python-heatclient/tree/envfiles
    if this becomes a blocking issue, we can add that method to horizon
    temporarily. The other possibility is that it is extended to support
    nested stacks as well (a Juno goal). This patch includes this code
    inside horizon, with the intention of removing it when support becomes
    available in upstream python-heatclient
  - there are outstanding messaging improvements (error messages, etc) that
    this patch could take advantage of for better message dialogs

To test this, check out sample environment & template files here. You'll
notice that the referenced file in the environment will get added in
stage2 of the wizard. If you don't have any file references to resolve,
it will go straight to stage3.
- https://github.com/hardys/demo_templates/blob/master/juno_summit_intro_to_heat/example2_server_with_volume_nested/server_with_volume.yaml
- https://github.com/hardys/demo_templates/blob/master/juno_summit_intro_to_heat/example4_provider_environment/env_server_with_volume.yaml
- https://github.com/hardys/demo_templates/blob/master/juno_summit_intro_to_heat/example4_provider_environment/server_with_volume_env.yaml

Closes-Bug: #1322258
Partial-Implements:
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/horizon/+spec/heat-nested-stack

Change-Id: I0916bfb22c80755efd3632c1315fe78afc86d38c

commit_message:
Move qos_dscp migration to the Newton alembic branch.

The migration, introduced in Ic3baefe176df05f049a2e06529c58fd65fe6b419,
was incorrectly landed in mitaka directory while it should have gone into
the newton directory.

Change-Id: Ieec13566b95b74152daf080772d9f648f456c796

commit_message:
[Launch Instance Fix] upstream deltas needed for neutron api

moved create Port to Ports
error message, docstring on python REST
js formatting/docstrings
fix for delete

This patch implements:
  -is_port_profiles_supported():
  -port_create
  -port_delete
  -profile_list(request, type_p)

Change-Id: Ib9ff33e662e23b4cd43ed23d7b7aa51d9ff8282b
Closes-Bug: 1434208
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/87/164287/17 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: /** * @name hz.api.neutronAPI.createPort * @description * create a port for a network. * @param {Object} newPort * The port to create. * * @property {string} newPort.device_id (optional) device id attached to the port * @property {string} newPort.tenant_id (optional) tenant id of the port created * @property {string} newPort.name (optional) name of the port created * @property {string} newPort.policy_profile_id (optional) profile id if policy profiles used * * @param {string} network_id * The network id to retrieve ports for. Required. */ this.createPort = function(network_id,newPort) { return apiService.post('/api/neutron/port/' + network_id, newPort) .error(function () { horizon.alert('error', gettext('Unable to create port.')); }); }; /** * @name hz.api.neutronAPI.deletePort * @description * delete a port on a network * * @param {string} port_id port to delete * @returns 204 on success */ this.deletePort = function(port_id) { return apiService.delete('/api/neutron/port' + port_id) .error(function () { horizon.alert('error', gettext('Unable to delete port.')); }); } // Neutron Config /** * @name hz.api.neutronAPI.getIsPortProfilesSupported * @description * returns a boolean indicating if network profiles are supported in this installation * * @returns {'result': true|false} */ this.getIsPortProfilesSupported = function() { return apiService.get('/api/neutron/is_port_profiles_supported') .error(function () { horizon.alert('error', gettext('Unable to retrieve port profiles supported.')); }); } //Profiles /** * * @param profile_type {string} profile type. One of "network" or "policy". Other values invalid * @returns {*} */ this.getProfiles = function(profile_type) { return apiService.get('/api/neutron/profiles/' + profile_type) .error(function () { horizon.alert('error', gettext('Unable to retrieve port profiles supported.')); }); } } // neutron.is_port_profiles_supported(): //api.neutron.port_create( request, net_id, policy_profile_id=profile_id,) //api.neutron.port_delete(request, port_id) //api.neutron.profile_list(request, type_p)

subject: Download Reports of Horizon Detailed Views, in dfferent formats
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-12-18 06:01:47.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/eb2e87c85d5b9569b7c66891f898d805432c59c5', 'message': "Download Reports of Horizon Detailed Views, in dfferent formats

The users will be able to generate a report manually at any time. This is
useful for capturing the updated information of instances, volumes,
flavors, etc at the moment. The generated report can then later be used for
sharing/mailing information. It will not only help the Project/Admin users
in planning, auditing and decision making, but also give a clear view to the
users about the existing data in the system.

Post the implementation, we might gather the users' feedback and expectations
to extend this Report functionality and have enhancements like creating
customized reports, scheduling, mailing and sharing them. Hence, this can be
taken up as a completely new module added to Horizon.

Change-Id: I4b06d8637a2b5cf2ccc905d4635b280d42366571
Partially-Implements: blueprint horizon-reports-in-different-formats

view to the users about the existing data in the system.
Currently, the report generation is available in CSV and PDF
through this blueprint.

Post the implementation, we might gather the users' feedback
and expectations to extend this Report functionality and have
enhancements like creating customized reports, scheduling,
mailing and sharing them. Hence, this can be taken up as a
completely new module added to Horizon.

Dependencies are added to https://review.openstack.org/#/c/163304

Change-Id: I4b06d8637a2b5cf2ccc905d4635b280d42366571
Partially-Implements: blueprint horizon-reports-in-different-formats
"}]
commit_message:
Download Reports of Horizon Detailed Views, in dfferent formats

The Admin users will be able to generate a report manually at
any time. This is useful for capturing the updated information
of instances, volumes, flavors, etc at the moment. The
generated report can then later be used for sharing/mailing
information. It will not only help the Project/Admin users in
planning, auditing and decision making, but also give a clear
view to the users about the existing data in the system.
Currently, the report generation is available in CSV and PDF
through this blueprint.

Post the implementation, we might gather the users' feedback
and expectations to extend this Report functionality and have
enhancements like creating customized reports, scheduling,
mailing and sharing them. Hence, this can be taken up as a
completely new module added to Horizon.

Dependencies are added to https://review.openstack.org/#/c/163304

Change-Id: I4b06d8637a2b5cf2ccc905d4635b280d42366571
Partially-Implements: blueprint horizon-reports-in-different-formats

commit_message:
Sys Info Panel - Directives instead of ng-include

An example of how using a directive, the redundant per-service table
and footer files can be removed. I didn't see an obvious
way to avoid using header and row fragments given the
way the smart table is implemented.

A nice improvement on this would be to change the directive to
transclude header and row content somehow, so that the header
and row for each service can live in the same file, allowing us
to simplify the solution to 1 overview page using 1 directive
with 1 data file per-service.

Change-Id: Id13144eb4dcb2db53fd335aa765fc09384fca784

commit_message:
Glance Image Member Management

Add a tab to Glance Image detail to manage members.
Member can be delete, add, view by member or admin.

Change-Id: I327036798c8ce94dbbc7f47479018a4ddb977509
implements: blueprint glance-image-member-management

added_lines: def image_member_create(request, image_id, member_id, can_share=False): glanceclient(request).image_members.create(image_id, member_id, can_share=can_share) def image_member_delete(request, image_id, member_id): glanceclient(request).image_members.delete(image_id, member_id) def image_member_list(request, image_id): return glanceclient(request).image_members.list(image=image_id)

commit_message:
Searchlight API for horizon

Adds a REST API to make requests to searchlight. Implements
POST searchlight/search and GET searchlight/enabled-resources.

This is essentially a pass-through API to enable searchlight
integration via AJAX requests.

Change-Id: I2309c7c3ef6d8cab8d6bafdf44f5b12c433a5f5c
Implements: blueprint searchlight-images-integration

commit_message:
Add Ironic hypervisor settings to hide some unsupported actions

As Ironic baremetal nodes do not support all variety of operations
that nova virtual instances do, so add a option to settings to make
Horizon disallow inappropriate actions to be performed.

Use '#!/usr/bin/env bash' as shebang in RC files

To be more consistent and portable '#!/usr/bin/env bash' should be
used as shebang in script files.

commit_message:
Ajax update for table row that has any unknown status

When an instance is deleting and in error status, no ajax update is
triggered for it because the row has .status_down instead of
.status_unknown. This change triggers ajax update for row that
contains any td.status_unknown.

Change-Id: If53d43fe1365144fd1b404755d179dc709154da3
Closes-Bug: 1445276

Instead, we should have one settings file for client-side

and one for server-side.

We don't want to break backward compatibility by removing

they should be stored in 'horizon/static/framework'.

commit_message:
Docs for moving future client-side settings out of settings.py

Client-side settings should not be stored in HORIZON_CONFIG
in settings.py. For example, things like page size, alert fade delays,
modal backdrop type, etc. This mixes up frontend and backend settings.

Instead, we should have one settings file for client-side
(anything used by the Horizon Angular framework)
and one for server-side.

We don't want to break backward compatibility by removing
the legacy options from settings.py, but for the future,
they should be stored in 'horizon/static/framework'.

The client-side settings are in:
horizon/static/framework/conf/conf.js

Change-Id: Icfaeee2f586e569020b657b3be97e6170b236c0d
Partially-Implements: blueprint client-side-configuration-file

commit_message:
Truncate instance creation pop-up message

When an instance is successfully (or unsuccessfully) created, a
message pop up appears that displays the corresponding alert
message and includes the instance name in it.  When the instance
name is extremely long, the pop up becomes too big.  There is no
need to display the entire instance name in this message when the
name is so big. It looks obnoxious and is unnecessary.  These
messages should be truncated to a specified length.

I based this change off of a similar change that propeses to
truncate resource names in all tables based on a setting that
is, as of right now, a global setting in local_settings.py.
I use this global setting to truncate the instance name in
the pop-up message box.

Closes-Bug: #1503408
Change-Id: Ib25468703094c305228fb49dae4940529162dfa1

commit_message:
Rename django-compressor to django_compressor

This is the proper pypi name which makes lookup easier. Also it matches
the name listed in the global requirements and makes setup possible
in stricter environmenets.

commit_message:
Provide option to create images by importing data

Move the "Copy data" checkbox option of the Create Image form into a
dropdown, and move the Images table into a tab. If Glance v2 is
available, add a new "Import data" option to the dropdown, which uses an
import task to create the image, and another tab in the Images panels
with a table listing all import tasks that have been created. Task names
in the table are rendered as links to details pages for the tasks.

Depends on https://review.openstack.org/#/c/217020 to keep filtering
working in the Images table after moving it from a DataTableView to a
TabbedTableView.

Change-Id: I3ce764f0f2fa42ba3f44617050cf10042dfdd8ee
Implements: blueprint import-images

added_lines: def task_get(request, task_id): """Returns a task populated with metadata for the task, with the supplied identifier. """ return glanceclient(request, '2').tasks.get(task_id) def task_list_detailed(request, marker=None, sort_dir=None, sort_key=None, filters=None, paginate=False): """List tasks.""" limit = getattr(settings, 'API_RESULT_LIMIT', 1000) page_size = utils.get_page_size(request) if paginate: request_size = page_size + 1 else: request_size = limit kwargs = {'filters': filters or {}} if marker: kwargs['marker'] = marker kwargs['sort_dir'] = sort_dir kwargs['sort_key'] = sort_key tasks_iter = glanceclient(request, '2').tasks.list(page_size=request_size, limit=limit, **kwargs) has_prev_data = False has_more_data = False if paginate: tasks = list(itertools.islice(tasks_iter, request_size)) # first and middle page condition if len(tasks) > page_size: tasks.pop(-1) has_more_data = True # middle page condition if marker is not None: has_prev_data = True # first page condition when reached via prev back elif sort_dir == 'asc' and marker is not None: has_more_data = True # last page condition elif marker is not None: has_prev_data = True else: tasks = list(tasks_iter) return (tasks, has_more_data, has_prev_data) def task_create(request, **kwargs): """Create an image via an import task.""" return glanceclient(request, '2').tasks.create(type='import', input=kwargs)

commit_message:
Update Settings tab in the dashboard

By default the Settings tab is under user icon
drop down menu. Once the Settings option is selected
from this drop down menu then only it will be
visible under dashboard tabs.

To resolve the ambiguity the Settings option is
removed from user drop down menu and added to
the dashboard tabs permanently.

Closes-Bug: #1331370

Change-Id: I0acafd9787dd759bfacbbe344392215278ef72e4

commit_message:
Add cancel button to create subnet workflow

There miss"Cancel" button in the create and update Subnet
workflow dialog in admin and project networks panel. But in
the create networks, there has cancel button. This patch
refactor the _workflow.html code, now all wizard workflow can
reuse it, and add cancel button to create and update subnet
workflow, also the ajax_template_name is no longer needs
and eliminating redundant code.

Change-Id: Ide889a8bf92ce27cff03baced7e356713ce16880
Closes-bug: #1480233

commit_message:
Adding angular prompt service

A prompt service, like window.prompt(), providing UI for user input,
and excute callback funtions when user input meet validation and the
Submit button clicked.

Change-Id: I4ccb4d037e9cbb8cb39b98bb4897769de36f754e
Implements: bp angular-prompt-service
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/99/241399/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: /* *  Copyright 2015 Hewlett Packard Enterprise Development Company LP * * Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); * you may not use this file except in compliance with the License. * You may obtain a copy of the License at * * http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 * * Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software * distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, * WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. * See the License for the specific language governing permissions and * limitations under the License. */ (function () { 'use strict'; /** * @ngdoc service * @name horizon.framework.widgets.modal.prompt * * @description * Emulating browser's window.prompt function to provide a popup * dialog for user to input data. * * @param {object} params, the specification object for the popup dialog. * @param {object} callback, the callback function with user input. * * @example: ```js prompt({ text: { title: gettext('Please input data'), submit: gettext('Ok'), cancel: gettext('Cancel'), placeholder: gettext('Input data') }, required: true }, function (input) { // ... }); ``` */ angular .module('hz.widget.modal') .factory('horizon.framework.widgets.modal.prompt', serviceFactory); serviceFactory.$inject = [ '$modal', 'basePath' ]; function serviceFactory($modal, basePath) { return prompt; function prompt(params, callback) { var m = $modal.open({ controller: Controller, templateUrl: basePath + 'modal/prompt/prompt.html' }); Controller.$inject = ['$scope']; function Controller($scope) { $scope.submit = submit; $scope.cancel = cancel; $scope.params = params || {}; } function submit(input) { callback(input); m.close(); } function cancel() { m.close(); } } } })();

subject: Add test for policy checks
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-04-09 14:07:28.000000000', 'files': ['horizon/test/tests/base.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/a70e1005f8bfeb618a2d2372c4b68a17febb91ec', 'message': 'Add test for policy checks

Created a policy test case for Panels which tests AND, OR and a mix
of AND OR logics. The test cases are :
P  = Policy rule for Panel
P1 = True
P2 = False
P3 = True
P4 = False

(P1, P2,) expands to P1 OR P2 results as True.

([P1, P2],) expands to P1 AND P2 results as False.

(P1, [P3, P4],)expands to P1 OR (P3 AND P4) results True.

Change-Id: Icf1a040c687bd8486eb2742f249d0a4e40a4f22a
'}]
commit_message:
Add test for policy checks

Created a policy test case for Panels which tests AND, OR and a mix
of AND OR logics. The test cases are :
P  = Policy rule for Panel
P1 = True
P2 = False
P3 = True
P4 = False

(P1, P2,) expands to P1 OR P2 results as True.

([P1, P2],) expands to P1 AND P2 results as False.

(P1, [P3, P4],)expands to P1 OR (P3 AND P4) results True.

Change-Id: Icf1a040c687bd8486eb2742f249d0a4e40a4f22a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/70/172070/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from django.test.utils import override_settingsclass PolicyOrAccessPanel(horizon.Panel): name = "Policy Panel OR" slug = "policy_panel_or" policy_rules = (("identity", "identity:list_projects"), ("identity", "identity:list_user_projects"),) class PolicyAndAccessPanel(horizon.Panel): name = "Policy Panel AND" slug = "policy_panel_and" policy_rules = ([("identity", "identity:list_projects"), ("identity", "identity:list_user_projects")],) class PolicyMixedAccessPanel(horizon.Panel): name = "Policy Panel MIXED" slug = "policy_panel_mixed" policy_rules = (('identity', 'identity:list_projects'), [('telemetry', 'telemetry:compute_statistics'), ('telemetry', 'telemetry:get_meter')],) def policy_check(rule, request): if not cmp(rule, (("identity", "identity:list_projects"),)): return True elif not cmp(rule, (("identity", "identity:list_user_projects"),)): return False elif not cmp(rule, (('telemetry', 'telemetry:compute_statistics'),)): return True elif not cmp(rule, (('telemetry', 'telemetry:get_meter'),)): return False else: return False class PolicyHorizonTests(test.TestCase): def setUp(self): super(PolicyHorizonTests, self).setUp() # Adjust our horizon config and register our custom dashboards/panels. self.old_default_dash = settings.HORIZON_CONFIG['default_dashboard'] settings.HORIZON_CONFIG['default_dashboard'] = 'cats' self.old_dashboards = settings.HORIZON_CONFIG['dashboards'] settings.HORIZON_CONFIG['dashboards'] = ('cats', 'dogs') base.Horizon.register(Cats) Cats.register(PolicyOrAccessPanel) Cats.default_panel = 'policy_panel_or' Cats.register(PolicyAndAccessPanel) Cats.register(PolicyMixedAccessPanel) # Trigger discovery, registration, and URLconf generation if it # hasn't happened yet. base.Horizon._urls() # Store our original dashboards self._discovered_dashboards = base.Horizon._registry.keys() # Gather up and store our original panels for each dashboard self._discovered_panels = {} for dash in self._discovered_dashboards: panels = base.Horizon._registry[dash]._registry.keys() self._discovered_panels[dash] = panels def tearDown(self): super(PolicyHorizonTests, self).tearDown() # Restore our settings settings.HORIZON_CONFIG['default_dashboard'] = self.old_default_dash settings.HORIZON_CONFIG['dashboards'] = self.old_dashboards # Destroy our singleton and re-create it. base.HorizonSite._instance = None del base.Horizon base.Horizon = base.HorizonSite() # Reload the convenience references to Horizon stored in __init__ reload(import_module("horizon")) # Reset Cats and Dogs default_panel to default values Cats.default_panel = 'kittens' # Re-register our original dashboards and panels. # This is necessary because autodiscovery only works on the first # import, and calling reload introduces innumerable additional # problems. Manual re-registration is the only good way for testing. self._discovered_dashboards.remove(Cats) for dash in self._discovered_dashboards: base.Horizon.register(dash) for panel in self._discovered_panels[dash]: dash.register(panel) @override_settings(POLICY_CHECK_FUNCTION=policy_check) def test_policy_check(self): context = {'request': self.request} cats = horizon.get_dashboard("cats") or_panel = cats.get_panel("policy_panel_or") self.assertTrue(or_panel.can_access(context)) and_panel = cats.get_panel("policy_panel_and") self.assertFalse(and_panel.can_access(context)) mixed_panel = cats.get_panel("policy_panel_mixed") self.assertTrue(mixed_panel.can_access(context))

commit_message:
Provide some protection against BREACH

Leverage the django-debreach middleware to provide protection against
a BREACH attack.

Depends-On: I931e7165dacfbc7f31e2e57ee4c46787990fefcc
Closes-Bug: #1209250
Change-Id: Ia66e5ad43bc8e42bc60f47aba3f8a0d6bfee028d

commit_message:
Provide flavor overview detail page

Currently nova flavors don't expose any url where you can check details
for them. This fix provides a detail page for flavors, where base
properties, as well as custom properties could be checked.

Co-Authored-By: Dhanvi <dhanviduri@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Kamil Rykowski <kamil.rykowski@intel.com>

Change-Id: Ia5b4a49a40213ca80d8d45ca4c7c3d092c8b7036
Closes-Bug: #1405063

commit_message:
Removing cisco n1kv profile support

As part of the horizon core-vendor decomposition, Cisco
N1Kv specific code and unit tests, in instance launch
would be moved to the horizon-cisco-ui repo.

Change-Id: I703bb5a885af9c98185c1a2103e46ad430579b05
Partially-Implements: blueprint horizon-vendor-split

commit_message:
Rename helpers.py to basetestcases.py

Original filename is confusing and don't reflect usage and most of content
so well.
The helpers.py now contains just gen_random_resource_name() method. All
test-related clases are currently moved into basetestcases.py

Partially implements blueprint: selenium-integration-testing
Implements blueprint: rename-helpers-to-basetests
Change-Id: Ie6b5d2085125245423efb68cd1ab2a42b182204c

subject: Remove app-specific config from framework module
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-07-20 21:23:23.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/833c8f6ddbc6a2580beae699c589a6cfe537cf2d', 'message': 'Remove app-specific config from framework module

Make framework.module.js easier to resuse by moving application
specific configuration logic to app.module.js.

framework.module.js is the root module for application agnostic,
reusable horizon componenents. It currently contains
"frameworkConfiguration" which is config logic that is specific
to a particular application (openstack_dashboard), such as the
default interpolator, at the HTTP 401 response interceptor.

This patch moves everything except the interpolator config into
app.module.js

Change-Id: I41aeb0a230864f19b961c3a3024166408bdea0a6
Fixes-Bug: 1474998

commit_message:
Remove app-specific config from framework module

Make framework.module.js easier to resuse by moving application
specific configuration logic to app.module.js.

framework.module.js is the root module for application agnostic,
reusable horizon componenents. It currently contains
"frameworkConfiguration" which is config logic that is specific
to a particular application (openstack_dashboard), such as the
default interpolator, at the HTTP 401 response interceptor.

This patch moves everything except the interpolator config into
app.module.js

Co-Authored-By: Shaoquan Chen <sean.chen2@hp.com>

Change-Id: I41aeb0a230864f19b961c3a3024166408bdea0a6
Closes-Bug: #1474998

commit_message:
Integration tests - Instances tests-VNC

Added testcase to verify the  vnc console when the instance
is running, vnc console status can be checked easily as its
an iframe element and selenium allows driver to switch between
frame elements.

modified:
instancespage.py and test_instances.py

Partially implements blueprint: integration-tests-hardening

Change-Id: Ieaf9543dfdb2485eaa753ccb27502e188edd1611
Closes-bug: #1414757

commit_message:
Filter out networks that have no subnets when launch instance

when launch instance, there list all networks containing the network
having no subnets, if chose the network having no subnets, It will
cast error. Filter out the network having no subnets will be more better.

Change-Id: Ib587718947d1c72b686018bfa5d2e3a5e6799d40
Closes-Bug: #1484834

commit_message:
Logout user when deleting currently logged-in project

Deleting currently logged-in project, renders the environment
inoperable. This patch, logs-out the user after he
successfully deletes currently logged-in project.

Implements: blueprint project-disabling-warning
Change-Id: I70f2793dc76a4b41e47b54fa1bfa340852ce2881

commit_message:
Proof of concept for push-based communication

This uses Zaqar's websocket service to update instance state listed in
/projects/instances/.

With this way, we need a dedicated queue in zaqar for each project to
get the notifications from Ceilometer's Zaqar publisher, which will be
tracked/implemented by separated work/patch.

To try it out, navigate to http://localhost:8080, log in and go to the
Project -> Instances page. Then launch an instance using the Nova
command line client and try to suspend, resume and delete it from there.
The UI should update automatically.

Implements blueprint realtime-communication

Signed-off-by: Tomas Sedovic <tsedovic@redhat.com>
Signed-off-by: Fei Long Wang <flwang@catalyst.net.nz>

Change-Id: I5bb39970dfd4a961b908fb2f34016957e8898c9c

commit_message:
Add a status to the process provided with the logout.

message of the process provided with the logout is error color,
since the message that is displayed after logout doesn't have
status attribute. This patch adds a status to the process
provided with the logout.

commit_message:
Add version check for listing namespaces

Listing metadata definitions namespaces requires glance API version
2. This adds a check that makes sure an empty array is returned if
any version less than 2 is being used.

Closes-Bug: #1516711
Partially-Implements: blueprint horizon-glance-v2
Change-Id: Ifc0a091318296da06168f9701a280eb7357632c7
(cherry picked from commit 0578023d881ab77fb6708ca39a99f772763ef1a6)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/27/256627/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: try: from glanceclient.v2 import client as glance_client_v2 VERSIONS.load_supported_version(2, {"client": glance_client_v2, "version": 2}) except ImportError: pass try: from glanceclient.v1 import client as glance_client_v1 VERSIONS.load_supported_version(1, {"client": glance_client_v1, "version": 1}) except ImportError: pass # Listing namespaces requires the v2 API. If not supported we return an # empty array so callers don't need to worry about version checking. if get_version() < 2: return [], False, False

commit_message:
Adds router create/delete integration tests

I have added test_router.py which tests create
router and delete router functionalities. To
allow this I have added routerpage.py with two methods
to create and delete router.

Partially implements blueprint: selenium-integration-testing

Change-Id: Ic6c7590fa8a69793ba5a49631e7a5192f020bdcf

See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import uuid from openstack_dashboard.test.integration_tests import helpers class TestRouter(helpers.TestCase): """Checks that the user is able to create/delete router.""" ROUTER_NAME = 'horizonrouter' + str(uuid.uuid4()) def test_router(self): router_page = self.home_pg.go_to_network_routerspage() router_page.create_router(self.ROUTER_NAME) self.assertTrue(router_page.is_router_present(self.ROUTER_NAME)) self.assertTrue(router_page.is_router_present(self.ROUTER_NAME)) router_page.delete_router(self.ROUTER_NAME) self.assertFalse(router_page.is_router_present(self.ROUTER_NAME))

commit_message:
Better validation of stack template and environment

The stack template and environment can be provided from several
sources such as inline, URL or file. The form includes dropdowns
that all the user to select which of the allowed sources to use.
This change prevents field validation on the input sources that
are not selected, only the content entered for the selected source
is validated. If any data is entered into form fields that are not
currently selected then that data is ignored, since it would be
unexpected to receive a validation failure for a form field that
is hidden.

Change-Id: I33f1d9f3aaef3998a4044d5ad6bd449f7218b83f
Closes-Bug: 1360244

subject: WIP: Convert the Heat stack creation wizard to a workflow
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-11-24 19:11:33.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/71a5ab05811541bb4a2e3a21f84db0e86d1485e3', 'message': "WIP: Convert the Heat stack creation wizard to a workflow

The current Heat stack creation wizard is implemented using two seperate
forms.  This results in the inability to move back and forth between steps
in the creation process without first cancelling the entire wizard and
starting over.  This change aims to improve the user experience on this
page by converting this wizard to a Horizon 'workflow'.  Being that it is a
workflow, users will have the ability to freely move back and forth between
steps to modify previous fields without cancelling the entire process and
starting over, much like the current implementations of many of the other
resource creation wizards (Instances, Images, Networks, etc.).

Some client side JS had to written in order to dynamically create fields
in step 2 of the workflow based on template parameters entered in step 1.
It is a bit of a workaround to the traditional implementation of a workflow,
which is why I imagine that it was not done as a workflow in the first place.
That being said, the workflow functions exactly as all other Horizon workflows
and still provides the same functionality as the existing Heat stack creation
wizard.

Co-Authored-By: Justin Pomeroy <jpomero@us.ibm.com>
Implements: blueprint launch-stack-workflow
Change-Id: I3232a31673fe4ae7951dda921aab4609447f3a3d

commit_message:
WIP: Convert the Heat stack creation wizard to a workflow

The current Heat stack creation wizard is implemented using two seperate
forms.  This results in the inability to move back and forth between steps
in the creation process without first cancelling the entire wizard and
starting over.  This change aims to improve the user experience on this
page by converting this wizard to a Horizon 'workflow'.  Being that it is a
workflow, users will have the ability to freely move back and forth between
steps to modify previous fields without cancelling the entire process and
starting over, much like the current implementations of many of the other
resource creation wizards (Instances, Images, Networks, etc.).

Some client side JS had to written in order to dynamically create fields
in step 2 of the workflow based on template parameters entered in step 1.
It is a bit of a workaround to the traditional implementation of a workflow,
which is why I imagine that it was not done as a workflow in the first place.
That being said, the workflow functions exactly as all other Horizon workflows
and still provides the same functionality as the existing Heat stack creation
wizard.

Co-Authored-By: Justin Pomeroy <jpomero@us.ibm.com>
Implements: blueprint launch-stack-workflow
Change-Id: I3232a31673fe4ae7951dda921aab4609447f3a3d

commit_message:
This patch creates a page which has four tables to show data of vpn.

It has data of Ikepolicy,data of,data of Vpnservice, and data of Ipsecsiteconnection.
The four parts are tables of vpn,here I put them in one page with one controller.
It follows the pattern with nguser.

Change-Id: Ifc57754cc22a18ff66c0c93b39e6409c905e20f4
Partially-Implements: blueprint angularize-vpn-table

commit_message:
This patch creates a page which has four tables to show data of vpn.
It has data of Ikepolicy,data of,data of Vpnservice, and data of Ipsecsiteconnection.
The four parts are tables of vpn,here I put them in one page with one controller.
It follows the pattern with nguser.
Partially-Implements: blueprint angularize-vpn-table

Change-Id: I62533c65291426828383ed6bcfb0b6c640aed747
Signed-off-by: hanjiabao <hanjiabao@awcloud.com>

See the * License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations * under the License. */ (function() { 'use strict'; /** * @ngdoc projectVpnsTabController * @ngController * * @description * Controller for the identity vpns table. * Serve as the focal point for table actions. */ angular .module('horizon.dashboard.project.vpns') .controller('projectVpnsTabController', projectVpnsTabController); projectVpnsTabController.$inject = [ 'horizon.framework.widgets.toast.service', 'horizon.framework.util.i18n.gettext', 'horizon.app.core.openstack-service-api.policy', 'horizon.app.core.openstack-service-api.keystone', 'horizon.app.core.openstack-service-api.vpn' ]; function projectVpnsTabController(toast, gettext, policy, keystone, vpn) { var ctrl = this; ctrl.iusers = []; ctrl.checked = {}; ctrl.ikepolicy = []; ctrl.vpnservice = []; ctrl.ipsecpolicy = []; ctrl.ipsecsiteconnection = []; init(); //////////////////////////////// function init() { // if vpn has permission // fetch table data and populate it var rules = [['project', 'project:list_projects']]; policy.check({ rules: rules }).success(policySuccess); } function policySuccess(response) { if (response.allowed) { vpn.getIkepolicy().success(getIkepolicySuccess); vpn.getIpsecpolicy().success(getIpsecpolicySuccess); vpn.getVpnservice().success(getVpnserviceSuccess); vpn.getIpsecsiteconnection().success(getIpsecsiteconnectionSuccess); } else { var msg = gettext('Insufficient privilege level to view user information.'); toast.add('info', msg); } } function getIkepolicySuccess(response) { ctrl.ikepolicy = response.ikepolicy; } function getIpsecpolicySuccess(response) { ctrl.ipsecpolicy = response.ipsecpolicy; } function getVpnserviceSuccess(response) { ctrl.vpnservice = response.vpnservice; } function getIpsecsiteconnectionSuccess(response) { ctrl.ipsecsiteconnection = response.ipsecsiteconnection; } } })();

commit_message:
Enhance test coverage for the framework module

Added a test to check that redirection does not occur when an authorize
user encounters an error that is not 401.

Co-Authored-By: Lauren Fitzgerald <lfitzger@thoughtworks.com>

Closes-Bug: #1499144

Change-Id: I9b19ce01c322b55586fc1048cf08677a6ce1a2f0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/96/227096/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: describe('when authorized but received not 401 error', function() { it("should not redirect to /auth/logout", inject(function($http, $httpBackend, $window) { $httpBackend.when('GET', '/api').respond(404, ''); $http.get('/api').error(function() { expect($window.location.replace).toNotHaveBeenCalled; }); $httpBackend.flush(); })); });

commit_message:
Add angular admin images panel

Adding the images panel to the admin dashboard that will use angular js
instead of django templates

To test set DISABLED=False in _2091_admin_ng_images_panel.py

Co-Authored-By: Rajat Vig<rajatv@thoughtworks.com>

Change-Id: Iec0a4978e8a2136e70abddd36a8caad4dbd9e895
Partially-Implements: blueprint angularize-images-table

commit_message:
Add pagination to Heat Stacks Details: Events

Project > Orchestration > Stacks >  Stack Details > Events Tab
Add missing Event tests too.

Change-Id: Ifc56c0e4cf4ddc0a5f6f0b9b8038e876f5af78a8
Closes-Bug: #1343684

commit_message:
Use workflow field errors on admin create flavor workflow

When input a flavor name or flavor ID that already exist, we will
see the error message on the top of the workflow modal. If the error
message beside the input box, it will be more better.

Change-Id: I2e8889a9bfac24811be8f0a7d624e4431cd46a38
Closes-Bug: #1487731
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/38/215938/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: error_msg = _("The name is already used by another flavor.") self._errors['name'] = self.error_class([error_msg]) if flavor.id == flavor_id: error_msg = _("The ID is already used by another flavor.") self._errors['flavor_id'] = self.error_class([error_msg])
deleted_lines: raise forms.ValidationError( _('The name "%s" is already used by another flavor.') % name ) if flavor.id == flavor_id: raise forms.ValidationError( _('The ID "%s" is already used by another flavor.') % flavor_id )

commit_message:
Angular-mock: using mock $window object

This patch leverages the sharable mock $window object in the modified
unit test.

Change-Id: Ibff7c8387731347b421a9fc2afdb47748b6398cb
Partially-Implements: blueprint horizon-angular-mocks
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/30/202830/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: beforeEach(module('horizon.mock.framework', function ($provide, mock_$window) { $provide.value('$window', mock_$window); beforeEach(module('horizon.framework'));
deleted_lines: // Mock $window. This allows our mock $window to be used // by horizon.framework's config block instead of the // real $window service. This prevents accidentally redirecting // the browser during testing. beforeEach(module('horizon.framework', function($windowProvider) { var window = { location: { replace: jasmine.createSpy() } }; $windowProvider.$get = function() { return window; };

subject: Single page navigation
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-11-30 22:23:29.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/34a0ae217dac210cd3a87d89a94caeb84334466a', 'message': "Single page navigation - angular

Based on Thai Tran's work this patchset is an ealry cut at implementing
similar functionality using angularjs rather than jQuery

There are a number of problems still to be resolved, but feedback is welcome.

Known issues:

  - Not all panels return a div with an id of #content_body ( in particular the
    volumes and hypervisors panels in Admin > System don't). This means that the
    panels do not load properly.

  - This patch does DOM monipulation in the controller, but I think this is
    unavoidable. I'd be happy to have someone prove me wrong however.

  - Error handling is incomplete.

  - No tests (and almost certainly breaks existing tests)

  - The new controller is not included in the minified js. This is deliberate.
    It allows easier debugging, but will need to be fixed before merging.

  - Probably other things, but that's what feedback is for...

Change-Id: I568b747c71f85541c50eafd9e4845e0772d6455d
Implements: blueprint single-page-navigation
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2014-11-30 22:31:41.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/b8cc27fc54e19f6b1cc42d269737e0d3fd40e059', 'message': "Single page navigation - angular

    don't). This means that the panels do not load properly.

  - Error handling is incomplete.

  - No tests (and almost certainly breaks existing tests)

  - The new controller and directive are not included in the minified
    js. This is deliberate.  It allows easier debugging, but will
    need to be fixed before merging.

  - Probably other things, but that's what feedback is for...

Change-Id: I568b747c71f85541c50eafd9e4845e0772d6455d
Implements: blueprint single-page-navigation

commit_message:
Single page navigation

Based on Thai Tran's work this patchset implements a way of simulating
a single page app whilst allowing the use of panels not yet rewritten
in angular.

It works by intercepting the navigation links and using an ajax call to
get the new page content rather than doing a full page refresh. This
improves performance by allowing for caching of angular and application
data. It is not a true single page app, but gets us a step closer.

Known issues:

  - More tests need to be implemented.

Change-Id: I568b747c71f85541c50eafd9e4845e0772d6455d
Implements: blueprint single-page-navigation

commit_message:
WIP - Disassociate more than one floating ips

Currently the user able to disassociate only one
ip at a time.

This patch enables the option to disassociate
more than one ip at a time.

Change-Id: I0e26f2050a65cd59ad6236b87c8a31bba9c6d286
Implements: blueprint disassociate-more-than-one-ip

commit_message:
Mock API - mock 401 error

This patch mocks 401 error in `horizon.mock.app.core.Server`. When
access a vaid URL in API, if has logged in, access is allowed,
otherwise, return 401 (Unauthorized) status code.

Change-Id: Ieb10a693755d19c6d30f5eae01fbfd85b25d6002
Partially-Implements: blueprint horizon-rest-api-mock

commit_message:
Adding NGProjects Create Action - Quota

This patch adds the members step to the create action
workflow.

To test, go to url /identity/ngprojects.

commit_message:
Added pagination support for swift containers.

The _more variable in the ContainerView has been split
in _more_containers and _more_objects to prevent overlaping
and perhaps allow future object pagination.
There have been changes in the _resource_browser template to
allow displaying the next page link; however, the embedding
form has not been changed (action remains without marker) and
the test only states the existence of the next link in the
first page

Closes-Bug: #1255411
Change-Id: I35ecaad41af93ed023b44011e9eb948cdb784911
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/46/88246/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from django.conf import settings from django.test.utils import override_settings @override_settings(API_RESULT_PAGE_SIZE=20) def test_swift_get_container_pagination(self): page_size = getattr(settings, 'API_RESULT_PAGE_SIZE', 20) containers = self.containers.list() swift_api = self.stub_swiftclient() swift_api.get_account(limit=page_size + 1, marker=None, full_listing=True).AndReturn((None, containers)) self.mox.ReplayAll() (conts, more) = api.swift.swift_get_containers(self.request, marker=None, paginate=True) self.assertEqual(len(conts), len(containers)) for cont in conts: self.assertIsInstance(cont, api.swift.Container) self.assertFalse(more) @override_settings(API_RESULT_PAGE_SIZE=1) def test_swift_get_container_pagination_more(self): page_size = getattr(settings, 'API_RESULT_PAGE_SIZE', 1) containers = self.containers.list() swift_api = self.stub_swiftclient() swift_api.get_account(limit=page_size + 1, marker=None, full_listing=True) \ .AndReturn((None, containers[:page_size + 1])) self.mox.ReplayAll() (conts, more) = api.swift.swift_get_containers(self.request, marker=None, paginate=True) self.assertEqual(len(conts), page_size) for cont in conts: self.assertIsInstance(cont, api.swift.Container) self.assertTrue(more) @override_settings(API_RESULT_PAGE_SIZE=1) @override_settings(API_RESULT_LIMIT=2) def test_swift_get_container_pagination_disabled(self): page_size = getattr(settings, 'API_RESULT_PAGE_SIZE', 1) limit = getattr(settings, 'API_RESULT_LIMIT', 2) containers = self.containers.list() swift_api = self.stub_swiftclient() swift_api.get_account(limit=limit + 1, marker=None, full_listing=True) \ .AndReturn((None, containers[:limit + 1])) self.mox.ReplayAll() (conts, more) = api.swift.swift_get_containers(self.request, marker=None, paginate=False) self.assertEqual(len(conts), limit) self.assertTrue(more)

subject: fix table action translation
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-17 02:01:46.000000000', 'files': ['horizon/tables/actions.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/14958dd995942a066de4512bd8192fa6dacf10cf', 'message': 'fix table action translation

Table action success message and info message are not
properly translated.
1, It is not necessary to translate the objects(objs)
2, Break down the msg into more granular level, so the
    django.po can be easily make.

Change-Id: I77da7f0659409a87808512e9deb9029b457ec293
Closes-Bug: #1534939
'}]
commit_message:
fix table action translation

Table action success message and info message are not
properly translated.
1, It is not necessary to translate the objects(objs)
2, Break down the msg into more granular level, so the
    django.po can be easily make.

Change-Id: I77da7f0659409a87808512e9deb9029b457ec293
Closes-Bug: #1534939
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/15/268715/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

This patch adds the members step to the create action

commit_message:
Adding NGProjects Create Action - Members

This patch adds the members step to the create action
workflow.

To test, go to url /identity/ngprojects.

Co-Authored-By: Paulo Ewerton <pauloewerton@lsd.ufcg.edu.br>
Co-Authored-By: Iury Gregory <iurygregory@gmail.com>

Partially-Implements: blueprint angularize-identity-projects

Change-Id: Ie088ea97c92df17055ae74f98f656dffa7b154e1

commit_message:
Topology View for Identity

Providing a topological view of identity entities(domains,
projects, groups, users and roles) aims openstack users
to have a bird-eye-view of how identity is structured
in their cloud. This patch, draws identity topology
canvas including all of the identity entries and their
hierarchical relations.

Change-Id: I5d72bf2d9b3b4d8c5899d06d29a899579ee9353b
Implements: blueprint identity-topology

subject: Add multi role test possibility to integr. tests
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-08-18 20:33:26.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/ad8ee498855fc884c2ca743ff17ca63cac29e106', 'message': "Add multi user test possibility to integr. tests

Adding possibility to run tests within perspective of multiple users as
well as demo or admin user only.

I have changed the behaviour of BaseTestCase, nows it redirects user
to login page automatically - as this is probably requirement for all
tests(in case of login test one needs to be on login page as well).
 I have added decorators that enables to specify user role within
which should be test executed when ran within MultiUserTestCase.

All test methods will now have suffix that says within which role was
test executed.(Accept for login tests and tests that inherits from
BaseTestCase class)

I have added following classes:

* MetaDemoUserTestCase - automatically adds 'as_demo' suffix to test
  methods name.

* MetaAdminUserTestCase - automatically adds 'as_admin' suffix to test
  methods name.

* MetaMultiUserTestCase - spawns two instances of each test with
  appropriate suffix unless decorator is used.

* LoggedInTestCase - Class for test cases that needs log out in tearDown

* AdminUserTesCase - Ensures that test is executed within admin user.

* DemoUserTesCase - Ensures that test is executed within demo user.

* MultiUserTestCase - Ensures that test is executed within correct user,
  this depends on test method suffix.

Decoratos:

* admin_user_only_testcase - makes test method executable only within
  admin user context

* demo_user_only_testcase - makes test method executable only within
  demo user context.

Closes-Bug: #1353334
Partially implements blueprint: selenium-integration-testing

Change-Id: I79ac16093a62591ece344794fb08139a1a0a8ab3

  this depends on test method suffix.

Decoratos:

* admin_user_only_testcase - makes test method executable only within
  admin user context

* standard_user_only_testcase - makes test method executable only within
  standard user(demo) context.

Closes-Bug: #1353334
Partially implements blueprint: selenium-integration-testing

Change-Id: I79ac16093a62591ece344794fb08139a1a0a8ab3

commit_message:
Add multi role test possibility to integr. tests

Adding possibility to run tests within perspective of multiple user roles.

I have changed the behaviour of BaseTestCase, nows it redirects user
to login page automatically - as this is probably requirement for all
tests(in case of login test one needs to be on login page as well).
I have added decorators that enables to specify user role within
which test should be executed when ran within MultiUserTestCase.

All test methods will now have suffix that says within which role was
test executed.(Accept for login_url test and tests that inherits from
BaseTestCase class generally)

I have added following classes:

* MetaStandardUserTestCase - automatically adds 'as_standard_user' suffix to
                             test methods name.

* MetaAdminUserTestCase - automatically adds 'as_admin_user' suffix to test
                          methods name.

* MetaMultiUserTestCase - spawns two instances of each test with
                          appropriate suffix unless decorator is used.

* LoggedInTestCase - class for test cases that needs log out in
                     tearDown.

* AdminUserTesCase - ensures that test is executed within admin user
                     role.

* StandardUserTestCase - ensures that test is executed within standard
                         user role.

* MultiUserTestCase - ensures that test is executed within correct user,
                      this depends on test method suffix.

Decoratos:

* admin_user_only_testcase - makes test method executable only within
                             admin user context

* standard_user_only_testcase - makes test method executable only within
                                standard user context.

Closes-Bug: #1353334
Partially implements blueprint: selenium-integration-testing

Change-Id: I79ac16093a62591ece344794fb08139a1a0a8ab3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/92/115092/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: Fix broken error message during subnet creation
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-11-13 21:56:05.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/179b7a1cbf5b14c4e66d883ebea373793fadecc7', 'message': "Fix broken error message during subnet creation

Steps to reproduce
1. In /etc/neutron/neutron.ini, add the following in the bottom of the file
   [metacloud]
   subnet_per_network = 1
2. Restart neutron-server (q-svc)
3. In horizon, create one network with two subnets.
4. You should see the second subnet creation throws error.
5. Notice the error message doesn't provide the network name correctly

The root cause is that one of the subnet workflows doesn't pass network object
as the create subnet function parameter.

Change-Id: I32257f14b231b01edcbac2559cf27b0bed0aa8bf
Closes-Bug: 1505414

commit_message:
Fix broken error message during subnet creation

Steps to reproduce
1. In horizon, create a subnet for a network address that already exists.
2. You should see the subnet creation throw an error.
3. Notice the error message doesn't provide the network name correctly

The root cause is that one of the subnet workflows doesn't pass network object
as the create subnet function parameter.

Change-Id: I32257f14b231b01edcbac2559cf27b0bed0aa8bf
Closes-Bug: 1505414

commit_message:
Don't show assigned ports in FIP target list

In the floating IP port list, ports already assigned floating IPs
shouldn't be available targets for new ones since neutron doesn't
allow multiple FIPs for a single fixed IP.

In this patch the filtering also occurs for nova networking
although I'm not 100% nova networking has the same restriction.

Change-Id: Icf55cb09b007e7764599b727eaa7e1e2ccecc323
Closes-Bug: 1413755
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/10/151410/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: neutron_enabled = api.base.is_service_enabled(request, 'network') if len(targets): # Get the existing list of floating IPs to filter the target list floating_ips = api.network.tenant_floating_ip_list(self.request) # port_id is mapped to instance id for nova networking fip_ports = [fip['port_id'] for fip in floating_ips] def fip_not_assigned(instance): if neutron_enabled: # Neutron targets have 'id' <port_id>_<port_ip_address> return instance['id'].split('_')[0] not in fip_ports else: return instance['id'] not in fip_ports targets = filter(fip_not_assigned, targets)

subject: Glance Image Member Management

commit_message:
Glance Image Member Management

Currently, Horizon does not allow to share images between
different projects. We have "Share With Me" container in
project image tab, but ability to share image is not
possible in horizon. This patch implements this feature.

Change-Id: I8ed245a8c6b28c20076624bdfe51b507a4215358
Implements: blueprint glance-image-member-management
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/91/242691/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def image_member_create(request, image_id, member_id): """Add a new member(project) to image.""" glanceclient(request).image_members.create(image_id, member_id) def image_member_delete(request, image_id, member_id): """Delete member(project) from image.""" glanceclient(request).image_members.delete(image_id, member_id) def image_member_list(request, image_id): """Delete member(project) from image.""" return glanceclient(request).image_members.list(image=image_id)

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-10-07 17:12:34.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/7f52eaa9e10fae9463eb079a326e5c4142782c23', 'message': 'Federated Identity Mapping

Federated identity management closely works with Keystone service to
authenticate and authorise users. Federation uses attributes provided by
identity providers and translates it to attributes recognised by OpenStack.
Federation has integrated functionality called attribute mapping that maps
attributes obtained from identity providers and maps them to attributes that
can be used in OpenStack cloud. Attribute mapping engine uses mapping rules to
map these attributes. Mapping rules are stored in database along with mapping
ID to identify these rules.

This interface allows the user to list, create, update and delete particular
mapping rules in order to reduce workload for the administrators and

@author Anton Brinda

commit_message:
Federated Identity Mapping

Federated identity management closely works with Keystone service to
authenticate and authorise users. Federation uses attributes provided by
identity providers and translates it to attributes recognised by
OpenStack.  Federation has integrated functionality called attribute
mapping that maps attributes obtained from identity providers and maps
them to attributes that can be used in OpenStack cloud. Attribute mapping
engine uses mapping rules to map these attributes. Mapping rules are
stored in database along with mapping ID to identify these rules.

This interface allows the user to list, create, update and delete
particular mapping rules in order to reduce workload for the
administrators and reduce security risks that are associated with
issuing provisional identities. The interface should be easily used
and understood even by novice administrators.

@author Anton Brinda
@coauthored-by David Chadwick

Change-Id: Id6b693ac642c1caf4765dedf2808d4ea340deba4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/14/232114/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines:
{% extends "identity/mappings/_modal_form.html" %} {% load i18n %} {% block modal-body-right %}

{% trans "Description" %}

Creating mapping rule is very easy. All you need to do is to fill up all text fields provided.

{% trans "Note #1" %}
If rule fulfills all the requirements to be saved "Save Rule" button will appear. At least one rule rule has to be created and mapping ID defined in order to "Create Mapping" button to appear.

{% trans "Note #2" %}
You can add and remove attributes by clicking on the button next to text field saying "Type".

{% trans "Note #3" %}
In order to be able to use "Value" text field you have to check one of the check boxes options above. If you check "Regex" option you also have to insert regex characters ".*" and '$' in front of and at the back of the word to by processed by regex. eg ".*username123$@example.com"

{% trans "Note #4" %}
You can only pick to map remote user into local group or user, therefore if you pick Group, Domains option is automatically disabled and vice versa.

{% trans "Note #5" %}
In order to Edit rule you have to click on the created rule and update button will appear. You can make any changes you like and click Update.

{% trans "Note #6" %}
You can remove rule by clicking on "X" from within the rule.

{% trans "Note #7" %}
Use drag and drop feature over created rules to reorder rules.

{% endblock %}

commit_message:
Document language list update in Horizon

Add some reference in our developer docs to including only
langauges which have reached 90% transaltion for Horizon.

Change-Id: Ibe80954f6875e35345bca80a77ff3d134b095743
Closes-bug: #1503022
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/58/231158/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Horizon gets translated into multiple languages. Near the end of the development cycle, openstack_dashboard/settings.py will be updated to include only languages which have Horizon at least 90% translated in Zanata. See https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/I18nTeam and https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/1.8/ref/settings/#languages for more information. The pseudo translation tool can be used to verify that code is ready to be translated. The pseudo tool replaces a language's translation with a complete, fake translation. Then you can verify that your code properly displays fake translations to validate that your code is ready for translation.
deleted_lines: Horizon gets translated into multiple languages. The pseudo translation tool can be used to verify that code is ready to be translated. The pseudo tool replaces a language's translation with a complete, fake translation. Then you can verify that your code properly displays fake translations to validate that your code is ready for translation.

commit_message:
Mock API - Basic mock API server constructor

This patch defines a constructor function `horizon.mock.app.core.Server`
on a mock module `horizon.mock.app.core`.  The constructor can be used
to create mock server instances.

Specs for the constructor is also created to spec the constructor and
show how to use it to construct mock server in specs.

Change-Id: Ia10ea724a3ebf1563a594d1b8958c7d052b5c4cf
Partially-Implements: blueprint horizon-rest-api-mock

added_lines: /** * (c) Copyright 2015 Hewlett-Packard Development Company, L.P. * * Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may * not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain * a copy of the License at * * http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 * * Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software * distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT * WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the * License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations * under the License. */ (function () { 'use strict'; var extend = angular.extend; /** * @ngdoc module * @name horizon.mock.app.core * @description * * # horizon.mock.app.core * * The `horizon.mock.app.core` module provides support to inject and * mock Horizon core application services into unit tests. */ angular .module('horizon.mock.app.core', []) .constant('horizon.mock.app.core.Server', Server); /** * @ngdoc constant * @name horizon.mock.app.core.Server * @module horizon.mock.app.core * @description * * # horizon.mock.app.core.Server * * A constructor function for mock server instances, defining it as a * constructor to ensure each mock server is independent. */ function Server() { this.$httpBackend; } extend(Server.prototype, { /** * @ngdoc method * @name start * @module horizon.mock.app.core * @description * * Creates a ngMock $httpBackend, then register all the resources * with it so that all the available resources can be served via the * API. * * @param resources */ start: function (resources) { var that = this; inject(function ($injector) { that.$httpBackend = $injector.get('$httpBackend'); }); this.registerResources(resources || []); }, /** * @ngdoc method * @name stop * @module horizon.mock.app.core * @description * * Flushes all the pending request and then destroy the ngMock * $httpBackend. */ stop: function () { try { this.$httpBackend && this.$httpBackend.flush(); delete this.$httpBackend; } catch(error) {} }, /** * @ngdoc method * @name registerResources * @module horizon.mock.app.core * @description * * Registers all the resources with it so that all the available * resources can be served via the API. * * @param resources */ registerResources: function (resources) { } }); }());

subject: Remove hard-coded $static_url in _variables.scss
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-02 04:57:14.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/themes/webroot/_variables.scss'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/aa3ee5adc05d50969d057f97c6c122230104fd6e', 'message': "Remove hard-coded $static_url in _variables.scss

The variable $static_url used in scss code is by default derived from the
option STATIC_URL in settings.py [1]. But the hard-coded definition
overrides that, causing the awesome fonts to be not found when running in the
Django developmental server, where the $static_url is expected to be
'/static/'. This commit removes the hard-coding and restores the
default.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/horizon/blob/master/horizon/utils/scss_filter.py#L35

Change-Id: I0fe115d299e7b98816ce9b3b2b41373364b439b3
Closes-Bug: 1539871

commit_message:
Remove hard-coded $static_url in _variables.scss

The variable $static_url used in scss code is by default derived from the
option STATIC_URL in settings.py [1]. But the hard-coded definition
overrides that, causing the awesome fonts to be not found when running in the
Django developmental server, where the $static_url is expected to be
'/static/'. This commit removes the hard-coding and restores the
default.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/horizon/blob/master/horizon/utils/scss_filter.py#L35

Change-Id: I0fe115d299e7b98816ce9b3b2b41373364b439b3
Closes-Bug: 1539871
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/07/275007/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @import "../themes/default/variables";
deleted_lines: /* This variable changes the web root of horizon to /dashboard rather than the default '/' */ $static_url: "/dashboard/static/"; @import "../themes/default/variables";

commit_message:
WIP : Angular panel for Metadata Definitions

Adding angularized panel for Metadata definitions.

Set DISABLED = False in
openstack_dashboard/enabled/_2131_admin_metadata_defs_panel.py

Subflows will be implemented in a later patch

Change-Id: Idb30b7e1ed3e85adbcab121a06686597a9ed1069

commit_message:
Remove dup custom style imports

Previously @import "/custom/styles"; has a comment of "// Custom Style
Variables " which make it looks like a scss file with only variables, in
that case it should be import to each scss file that will be injected to
_stylesheet.html directly. Confirm with devs, "/custom/styles" should
only include custom styles, than it should be imported only once.

Also, we need to make sure, /custom/styles should come at the very
bottom of the combined css file.

Change-Id: Ic9f168b746ed51c2c0ee864759c36a77d9645241
Closes-Bug: #1480427

commit_message:
Use unicode characters in integration tests entities names

Start with Russian translation of word 'horizon' ('') as
standard prefix for names of entities created/removed in the course of
tests.

Closes-Bug: #1493998
Change-Id: I7f56fb032ac9d7c9847f90e540ea17ca28502acf

commit_message:
Activate the timezone while we can get from request.COOKIES

How to reproduce the problem.
The instance is created at Jan. 17, 2015, 3:02 p.m.(UTC +08:00),
The creation time in UTC is Jan. 17, 2015, 7:02 a.m.

1. Save Timezone as UTC in user settings page,
   the creation time is Jan. 17, 2015, 7:02 a.m.
2. Save Timezone as UTC +08:00 in user settings page,
   the creation time is Jan. 17, 2015, 3:02 p.m.
3. logout horizon
4. login horizon
5. the timezone of user settings page is UTC +08:00,
   but the creation time of instance in detail page
   is UTC time(Jan. 17, 2015, 7:02 a.m.)

lastly, the patch fix it.

Change-Id: Id1fd61e8d7c5bb1424017cb7263dc85e0dc0af8f
Closes-Bug: 1418031
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/88/152888/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Use Behave as an alternate integration test suite

Shows a small demo of running integration tests with
behave and gherkin language.
Provides the following tests from the integration tests:
 - login admin/demo/failure
 - help redirection
 - image create/delete

Change-Id: Idb2e3be2e1aaf5521f054c28b81cc44f3c8188db

added_lines: from selenium.webdriver import Firefox from openstack_dashboard.test.integration_tests import config import uuid def random_name(prefix): return '{}_{}'.format(prefix, uuid.uuid4()) def before_all(context): context.flavor_name = random_name('flavor') def before_scenario(context, scenario): context.browser = Firefox() cfg = config.get_config() context.horizon_config = cfg context.base_url = context.horizon_config.dashboard.dashboard_url context.users = { cfg.identity.username: cfg.identity.password, cfg.identity.admin_username: cfg.identity.admin_password, 'wrong': 'user_does_not_exists' # non existent user } def after_scenario(context, scenario): context.browser.quit()
