subject: Fix compatibility mode of backup jobs scheduling
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-16 13:36:45.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/backup/api.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/128dacc6188d398dcd45ba4862243a8621f0d82f', 'message': "Fix compatibility mode of backup jobs scheduling

While testing interoperability of Liberty and Mitaka services I've found
two problems with backup jobs scheduling when running in non-scalable
mode (this happens when we run mixed Liberty and Mitaka c-bak services,
so during the live upgrade).

First of all when passing volume.host into scheduling we don't strip it
from backend and pool parts (@backend#pool), so in multi-backend
environment scheduling doesn't match backup host names and that clue is
silently ignored.

Second problem is that we don't pass the target volume's host into the
scheduling when restoring the volume. This means that we don't schedule
the jobs exactly the old way and it may happen that Liberty's
cinder-backup will receive restore request with a target volume he don't
have access to.

This commit sorts both problems out. Please note that this is very
low-risk, as it affects only this non-scalable mode, which without this
is broken anyway.

Change-Id: Ib7195f27a1e455732db8621cd09ba87daa5d5a33
Closes-Bug: 1558073
"}]
commit_message:
Fix compatibility mode of backup jobs scheduling

While testing interoperability of Liberty and Mitaka services I've found
two problems with backup jobs scheduling when running in non-scalable
mode (this happens when we run mixed Liberty and Mitaka c-bak services,
so during the live upgrade).

First of all when passing volume.host into scheduling we don't strip it
from backend and pool parts (@backend#pool), so in multi-backend
environment scheduling doesn't match backup host names and that clue is
silently ignored.

Second problem is that we don't pass the target volume's host into the
scheduling when restoring the volume. This means that we don't schedule
the jobs exactly the old way and it may happen that Liberty's
cinder-backup will receive restore request with a target volume he don't
have access to.

This commit sorts both problems out. Please note that this is very
low-risk, as it affects only this non-scalable mode, which without this
is broken anyway.

Change-Id: Ib7195f27a1e455732db8621cd09ba87daa5d5a33
Closes-Bug: 1558073

commit_message:
Add backup RPC API v2.0

This patch creates backup RPC API version 2.0, while retaining
compatibility in rpcapi and manager for 1.x, allowing for continuous
deployment scenarios.

This should be merged just before the Mitaka release.

UpgradeImpact - Deployments doing continous deployment should not
upgrade into Newton before doing an upgrade which includes all the
Mitaka's RPC API version bump commits (scheduler, volume, backup).

Related-Blueprint: rpc-object-compatibility

Change-Id: I0c66e4126901e6d60054d093cf87d43f4b9df666

commit_message:
Fix Security-rule's protocol and ethertype consistency issue

security rule ethertype can be set ipv6 when protocol is icmp.

This patch add check when protocol is icmp,ethertype value ipv6
should not accepted.

Change-Id: I27564bc649db0bafb630c0a8b7cb4f6a0679fff0
Closes-Bug: #1532061

commit_message:
Outerjoin to networks for port ownership filter

Change I55328cb43207654b9bb4cfb732923982d020ab0a
added a port filter to compare tenant ID to the
network owner as well. This caused the networks
table to be added to the FROM statement since
ports wasn't joined to networks for any other
reason. This resulted in an explosion of records
returned (networks * ports). SQLAlchemy would
de-dup this for us when iterating over results;
however, it would completely break the 'count()'
operation required by get_ports_count (which
the quota engine uses).

Change-Id: I5b780121ba408fba691fff9304d4a22e5892b85f
Closes-Bug: #1558827

commit_message:
[CI] Check nova is available in deployment

At current moment attempt to create flavor
without checking nova availability leads
to failures on some gates, for example
gate-kuryr-dsvm-rally-nv. This patch eliminates
that issue.

Change-Id: Iee1e76d2fe8cc326686b67a27e0ab90469d54944
Closes-Bug: #1556775
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/rally refs/changes/55/293955/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if rally deployment check | grep 'nova' | grep 'Available' > /dev/null; then nova flavor-create m1.nano 42 64 0 1 fi

commit_message:
dscp: follow up patch

Switch dscp rule object to a custom dscp enum type field. Avoid
test_base changes to hack around enum limitations.

Partial-Bug: #1468353

commit_message:
Do not set Gnocchi coordinator backend

Let's use the default value, which is SQL based and more robust in this
context.

Closes-Bug: #1557593

commit_message:
Put in order CEPH init exec calls

If it the first node in the cluster ceph-mon should be initialized
before OSDs

Change-Id: I9844daa2769d72304414db71f26fcde349099964
Closes-bug: #1551213

Release names in lower format

The release name should be in lower case, because
all release name comparisons expects it in lower case.

Closes-Bug: #1558953

commit_message:
Set update_at to new value after resize

No matter a cluster_resize is a deep one (that involves creation or
deletion of nodes) or a shallow one (that involves just size constraints
adjustments), we should always change the 'updated_at' property.

Change-Id: Iaacfdd93fb970ddc2bfb6d1de23b901e39376e20
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/senlin refs/changes/24/294424/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: elif status == self.ACTIVE and self.status == self.UPDATING:

commit_message:
Improve TripleO testing coverage for Puppet OpenStack CI

* Export puppet-barbican & puppet-oslo refs in TripleO jobs
* Run TripleO jobs when testing puppet-oslo and puppet-vswitch, two
  modules consummed or going to be (very soon) consummed by TripleO.

Change-Id: I11c1a1afef0ce76f50847b4a36f21a4b5039dc95
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/09/294009/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Enable gate jobs for Packstack on the stable/mitaka branch

The work to enable gate jobs for Packstack was done throughout the
Mitaka cycle and thus jobs were only enabled on Master. Now that
Mitaka stable branch is cut, run gate jobs on every branch except
stable/liberty and stable/kilo.

Change-Id: I9ab03d8a8c7c0ae0c02bc251893836a9da04aaf8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/34/294234/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Packstack integration jobs should only run on master and stable/mitaka # onwards branch: ^(?!stable/(kilo|liberty).*$
deleted_lines: # Packstack integration jobs should only be on the master branch for the # time being. It will be updated to run on stable releases as well from # Mitaka onwards when it is cut. branch: master

commit_message:
Adding Vagrantfile for local developer testing

This Vagrantfile attempts to replicate the gate check
testing to the extent possible to allow developers to
run all tests locally in a Vagrant environment prior
to submitting changes for review.

Contributor documentation updated to demonstrate usage
of the Vagrantfile.

Change-Id: I5f28e0cafc358b868d633acc0628a93b5cd0ab48
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-galera_client refs/changes/34/287534/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Vagrant.configure(2) do |config| config.vm.box = "ubuntu/trusty64" config.vm.provision "shell", inline: <<-SHELL sudo su - cd /vagrant apt-get update ./run_tests.sh SHELL end

commit_message:
oslo.db: don't run tests with SQLAlchemy 0.9.x

We've been running tests with different SQLAlchemy release series
supported, but since Ic7ab3b9e6dc8354861be1af46210269f74c04333
oslo.db actually requires SQLAlchemy >= 1.0.10, so testing of 0.9.x
versions is not needed anymore.

Keep the job for stable/kilo and stable/liberty.

Change-Id: I591ec39572a725455aef52b3bc60d7a419daeb16

commit_message:
Fix event list sorting

At the client side, we should not attempt to do sorting again when
listing events. Events are already sorted based on timestamp and id.

Closes-Bug: #1558882
Change-Id: I2c42123bbde532080d752769a0d821f107e3aad1

commit_message:
Add non voting job to test k8s with dib atomic image

Based on the atomic image generated with diskimage-builder,
we will use the uploaded image in fedorapeople to do functional
testing on magnum and prove the image.

Change-Id: I730e797f94601688bd97514c312bb628c7604cda

commit_message:
Make nullable of fields in db model and object match

Currently there are some fields whose nullable in db
model and object don't match. This may lead object query
fails.

For example, for volume, if attach_status is nullable in
db schema, but is not nullable in object schema.
When writting data to db using db interface, the attach_status
can be null. But later when reading data from db to construct
volume object, it raises exception. As a result, all the
query related to the volume fails.

This patch is to make all the fields in corresponding db
model and object match.

Change-Id: I84fb16f0a67f9a1f7a09e91bb8ebe6298f3f49c4
Closes-Bug: #1549669
Related-Bug: #1549673

commit_message:
Add size checking when adding nodes

When adding nodes to a cluster, we should check the cluster size
constraints as early as possible instead of forking an action that will
fail later.

commit_message:
Use default service_type for Murano endpoints

Currently we have outdated Murano service_type in Murano keystone
modular. Service_type has been updated in Murano upstream source code [1]
and then was updated in upstream Murano puppet manifests [2]. But library
still has outdated value.

This patch switches using of service_type parameter to upstream puppet
default value, because we don't have any specific changes on Fuel side.

[1] Id568c0a59b2e99dc946b1f2f55f6b233fd6a1b27
[2] Ib0059f7f35744c22b0fbd2be5917d8818d392422

Change-Id: I762801c7c49e806f52c03f72275a527350c6be34
Closes-bug: #1558035

commit_message:
Change float to integer for cgroups memory value

Cgconfigparser can't parse float values and cgroups
settings doesn't apply on the nodes. So, function
should convert counted memory value to integer.

Change-Id: I65bb1df9a93d46e8313c6ba8c8f23ec6d37bb14d
Closes-bug: #1558103

commit_message:
Fixed missing relations in tasks graph

The attributes 'requires_ex' and 'required_for_ex' was lost
durring extracting relations for task

Closes-Bug: 1558117

commit_message:
Provide multipath-tools package for compute node

While we can configure ISCSI Multipath for nova compute, we will need to
install multipath-tools package manually to make Multipath work.
We can not attach volumes to instance when ISCSI Multipath enabled if
multipath-tools package isn`t installed.

Change-Id: Iad6819023aaa2b27bf78ca465eaf9aab5612f744
Closes-Bug: #1515291

commit_message:
Gate: Ensure that AIO container apt components match the host

This patch ensures that if the host is set to bootstrap with a different
set of components to the default, all containers will have the same set
of components.

Change-Id: I280ea0fc200450e5e4fc3147dbee353775e76df0

commit_message:
MongoDB cluster grow failing in get_admin_password

Fix the logic of creating/getting the admin password for MongoDB query
routers.

Change-Id: I9187a8db2e4e66bc8e0e61b4105fcef80d5ae705
Closes-bug: #1526024

commit_message:
Secure mongodb instances and clusters by default

MongoDB's default behaviour is to have the authorization rules disabled.
This means any client can access the database without credentials. This
is too large of a risk for default behaviour, so authorization needs to
be enabled by default.

This fix addresses the problem by setting the authorization parameter to
enabled for standalone instances, and specifying key files for cluster
instances to use.

Change-Id: I5895ce66ec450c3efce7a7e0f126ac13ac4c1b12
Closes-bug: #1507841

commit_message:
Fix python-ironicclient pip install breakage

The pypi mirror that the openstack gate uses does not normalise -
and _ separators, whereas other pypi mirrors do. This is stopping
other reviews such as https://review.openstack.org/#/c/293779/
from passing tests.

Change-Id: I9b8bb450e199aadf3123b9a74cfe953e05d89952
Signed-off-by: Michael Davies <michael@the-davies.net>

commit_message:
Add retry logic for detaching device using LibVirt

Add retry logic for removing a disk device from the LibVirt
guest domain XML. This is needed because immediately after a guest
reboot, libvirtmod.virDomainDetachDeviceFlags() will silently fail
to remove the mapping from the guest domain. The async retry
behavior is done in Guest and is generic so it can be re-used by any other
detaches which hit this same race condition.

Change-Id: I983f80822a5c210929f33e1aa348a0fef91e890b
Closes-Bug: #1374508
(cherry picked from commit 3a3fb3cfb2c41ad182545e47649ff12a4f3a743e)

commit_message:
Install apparmor b/c Docker.io has undeclared dep

Docker has an undeclared dependency on apparmor for Ubuntu Trusty,
preventing the daemon from running and causing any -src jobs for IPA to
fail when using docker to build the package.

This should unbreak the IPA gate.

Change-Id: I98540286000d0cb1fe7649db5278c0a959ba8ad1
Closes-bug: 1558680
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/43/294343/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Implementation of couchdb user and database functions

This patch implements the following functions and
associated unit tests for the couchdb datastore-

-create user
-list user
-delete user
-get user
-create database
-list database
-delete database
-grant access
-revoke access
-list access
-enable root
-is root enabled

Change-Id: I47759b5c1462c6f76b4631e4a915a3c3902dae1a
Implements: blueprint couchdb-database-user-functions
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/trove refs/changes/04/273204/18 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from os import path COUCHDB_ADMIN_NAME = 'os_admin' COUCHDB_CREATE_ADMIN = "curl -X PUT http://127.0.0.1:" + COUCHDB_HTTPD_PORT + "/_config/admins/" + COUCHDB_ADMIN_NAME + " -d '\"password\"'" COUCHDB_ADMIN_CREDS_FILE = path.join(path.expanduser('~'), '.os_couchdb_admin_creds.jason') CREATE_DB_COMMAND = "curl -X PUT http://os_admin:password@localhost:" + COUCHDB_HTTPD_PORT + "/%(dbname)s" DELETE_DB_COMMAND = "curl -X DELETE http://os_admin:password@localhost:]" + COUCHDB_HTTPD_PORT + "/%(dbname)s" LIST_DB_COMMAND = "curl -X GET http://os_admin:password@localhost:" + COUCHDB_HTTPD_PORT + "/_all_dbs" CREATE_USER_COMMAND = "curl -X PUT http://os_admin:password@localhost:" + COUCHDB_HTTPD_PORT + "/_users/org.couchdb.user:username" + "-H \"Accept: application/json\"" + "-H \"Content-Type: application/json\"" + "-d '{\"name\": \"%(username)s\", \"password\": \"%(password)s\", \"roles\": [], \"type\":\"user\"}'" DELETE_REV_ID = "curl -s http://os_admin:password@localhost:" + COUCHDB_HTTPD_PORT + "/_users/_all_docs" DELETE_USER_COMMAND = "curl -X DELETE http://os_admin:password@localhost:" + COUCHDB_HTTPD_PORT + "/_users/org.couchdb.user:%(username)s?rev=%(revid)s" GRANT_USER_ACCESS = "curl -X PUT http://os_admin:password@localhost:" + COUCHDB_HTTPD_PORT + "/%(dbname)s/_security" + "-d '{\"admins\":{\"names\":[], \"roles\":[]}, \"members\":{\""+ "names\":[\"%(login)s\"],\"roles\":[]}}'" REVOKE_USER_ACCESS = curl -s http://os_admin:password@localhost:5984/_users/_all_docs ALL_DBS_COMMAND = "curl -X http://os_admin:password@localhost:5984/_all_dbs" DB_ACCESS = "curl -X http://os_admin:password@localhost:" + COUCHDB_HTTPD_PORT + "/%(dbname)s/_security"

commit_message:
Fix pagination function

The marker should be the last element in the current page and not the
first element in the next page.
Also updated the scenario tests to account for different
marker format of MySQL-based instances and fixed the assertion arg order.

Change-Id: Iff5d9c4e55f9146ce7132c7968087b7e834e793e
Closes-Bug: 1540172

commit_message:
Install Elasticsearch and Kibana packages using yum/apt-get

Test results of this patch set are at
http://paste.openstack.org/show/490450/.

Change-Id: I2957cc70fcca34706ec50a630d785f0630c3f5c0
Closes-Bug: #1553203
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla refs/changes/86/291986/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: RUN useradd -r -m --user-group kibana \ && usermod -a -G kolla kibana {% if install_type == 'binary' %} {% if base_distro in ['ubuntu'] %} RUN apt-get install -y --no-install-recommends wget \ && wget -qO - https://packages.elastic.co/GPG-KEY-elasticsearch \ | sudo apt-key add - \ && echo "deb http://packages.elastic.co/kibana/4.4/debian \ stable main" | sudo tee -a /etc/apt/sources.list \ && apt-get update \ && apt-get install -y --no-install-recommends kibana \ && apt-get clean {% endif %} {% elif install_type == 'source' %} {% endif %}
deleted_lines: RUN useradd -r -m --user-group kibana \ && usermod -a -G kolla kibana

commit_message:
Fix missing parameter for __update_cluster_status

'cluster' parameter was missing in one of the calls to __update_cluster_status().

Change-Id: I6882bc9a91b2009effc20def6ebe958a4e29cdfb
Closes-Bug: #1558797

commit_message:
Add unmap to cinder for ceph

This matches the current default for nova.conf. Use unmap/discard if
t is enabled on the hypervisor. This option is new for mitaka.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: Id94c05e2ec8a65c75ec82afcd4150390f8b87ee2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla refs/changes/72/294372/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: report_discard_supported = True

Create share API without checking share network in DHSS=true mode.

DHSS=true mode, it will return false.

commit_message:
Check share-network in 'share create' API

For the moment it is possible to schedule share creation with DHSS=true
share type but without share network. But it makes no sense, and
expected to fail. So, perform check on API level.

APIImpact
When create share with share type(DHSS=true) and not input share
network, API will return HTTPBadRequest and message:
"Share network must be set when the driver_handles_share_servers
is true."

Closes-Bug: #1525125
Change-Id: Icdfabff7b1d3b6e95dd1dd58a0155de637056657
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/manila refs/changes/53/256353/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: share_type = \ share_type = share_types.get_share_type( share_type = def_share_type if (share_type.get('exta_specs').get('driver_handles_share_servers') and no (share_network_id and snapshot)): msg = _('Share network must be set when the ' 'driver_handles_share_servers is true') raise exc.HTTPBadRequest(explanation=msg) kwargs['share_type'] = share_type

subject: Fix empty 'href' in link actions after AJAX actions_update
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-07 13:44:04.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/e9b5b4bcf33fd19ec44b7573eb3fc728c306fc97', 'message': "Fix empty 'href' in link actions after AJAX actions_update

Since the non-existent template being used in
horizon.datatables.update_actions has been fixed (thanks to
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/281450/), we've started to experience
missing href for link actions in a table header (i.e. table actions)
after actions update.

This is fixed by first looking for `bound_url` (which is set for row
actions), then falling back to `get_link_url()` which is set for all
link actions. Given that we're branching on `bound_url` for the
actions which method isn't 'POST', we shouldn't hit not existing
`get_link_url` method (because the only non-POST action available is a
LinkAction).

Change-Id: I46e27178d74815d945c752bf3b7302b7f0ddc27d
Closes-Bug: #1553314
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-03-08 12:03:40.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/6d04a7eecb31f4f0e43d2286394ce05e9645cc69', 'message': "Fix empty 'href' in link actions after AJAX actions_update

Since the non-existent template being used in
horizon.datatables.update_actions has been fixed (thanks to
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/281450/), we've started to experience
missing href for link actions in a table header (i.e. table actions)
after actions update.

This is fixed by first looking for `bound_url` (which is set for row
actions), then falling back to `get_link_url()` which is set for all
link actions. Given that we're branching on `bound_url` for the
actions which method isn't 'POST', we shouldn't hit not existing
`get_link_url` method (because the only non-POST action available is a
LinkAction).

Guard against the bug regression with create_volume integration tests.

Change-Id: I46e27178d74815d945c752bf3b7302b7f0ddc27d

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/281450/), we've started to experience
missing href for link actions in a table header (i.e. table actions)
after actions update.

This is fixed by explicitly passing 'is_table_action' flag while
rendering create/launch LinkAction-s that are known to be updated
after AJAX row update.

Guard against the bug regression with create_volume integration tests.

Change-Id: I46e27178d74815d945c752bf3b7302b7f0ddc27d

commit_message:
Fix empty 'href' in link actions after AJAX actions_update

Since the non-existent template being used in
horizon.datatables.update_actions has been fixed (thanks to
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/281450/), we've started to experience
missing href for link actions in a table header (i.e. table actions)
after actions update.

This is fixed by explicitly passing 'is_table_action' flag while
rendering create/launch LinkAction-s that are known to be updated
after AJAX row update.

Guard against the bug regression with create_volume integration tests.

Change-Id: I46e27178d74815d945c752bf3b7302b7f0ddc27d
Closes-Bug: #1553314

commit_message:
Unskip test_list_virtual_interfaces

Nova will return a 400 in the case of using Neutron as the
network API. Remove the skip such that a 400 is expected in
the case of using Neutron, else it's a failure.

Nova will implement the API for neutron in a microversion.

Depends-On: I27f48b38d64b34277f001fba86b4e64e9ead937c

Change-Id: I409fc6349a40396be68796fc82e5c1f37242bbdb
Related-Bug: #1183436

commit_message:
Revert "LXC/LXD driver"

This reverts commit 466a19f18f12cb77b45aa7c7a272fae7c45c4c93.
Also this reverts commit 4f74b224fad7bf9ca665d70a66c79c98cf8d5674.

Manila has decided to remove LXD from the Mitaka release.
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-March/089522.html

Change-Id: I3c4b15e8c9d92c874be754205b0b981151809cc1

Best practice is to instantiate predicate with functools.partial() :param timeout: Timeout in seconds how long should function wait. :param sleep: Polling interval for results in seconds. :param exception: Exception class for eventlet.Timeout. (see doc for eventlet.Timeout for more information) """ with eventlet.timeout.Timeout(timeout, exception): while not predicate(): eventlet.sleep(sleep)

commit_message:
Return 400 for os-virtual-interfaces when using Neutron

If using the Neutron network API, listing VIFs will return
a 500. This changes that to return a 400, which does not
require a microversion according to our docs:

http://docs.openstack.org/developer/nova/api_microversion_dev.html

A later change will introduce a microversion to implement the
method for the Neutron API.

Conflicts:
        nova/api/openstack/compute/legacy_v2/contrib/virtual_interfaces.py
        nova/api/openstack/compute/virtual_interfaces.py
        nova/tests/unit/api/openstack/compute/test_virtual_interfaces.py

NOTE(mriedem): The conflicts are due to the module paths moving in
Liberty and the fake HTTPRequest didn't have the wsgi_api_version kwarg
in Kilo.

Change-Id: I27f48b38d64b34277f001fba86b4e64e9ead937c
Related-Bug: #1183436
(cherry picked from commit cae96dccaff6d11e8dbd0e043676eb86e6fe73d8)
(cherry picked from commit c5da5d05763133b52cc9f3bf60884195c9dcab16)

commit_message:
Adding a note to 'test_update_user_password' test for Keystone V2

A note with time.sleep(1) were added for consistency like it is done
for the corresponding tests in [1]. Also, a few typos were fixed and
weird self.assertEqual(...)

    subject_token = resp['x-subject-token']
    ...
    self.assertEqual(resp['x-subject-token'], subject_token)

was deleted.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/275497/

Change-Id: I9cdd49a5361e21205a470da21d5cf69ce5b464bf

commit_message:
Tolerate both new and old setuptools

New setuptools 20.2.2 seems to be throwing a new exception
as it uses a vendorized version of packaging now. Let's make
sure our tests works with both the older and newer versions.

This is a backport of Iab9247e2026896bb7d25b125788ec3072f819dad.

(cherry picked from commit 0cf3c06ad98fa86378ffd561b65c0154989b179c)

Comment other-requirements.txt

Add a comment why the database packages are currently needed in the
file.

This is a backport of Idbbdf7aa905e42eb36733271ef482989120c426f.

(cherry picked from commit e19caa9c0e8342e983132dab9e470ec69c973820)

Fix other-requirements.txt

With the switch to bindep based packages the other-requirements.txt file
is used. It contains an error: The libxslt devel is called
libxslt1-dev on Ubuntu Trusty.

Also, add mysql-server and mysql-client packages, as well as postgresql
packages, those are needed by gate-requirements-python27.

Add pypy packages for pypy gate.

This is a backport of Ie143ad862b88034ef47470b85fd02c1d040415a7.

Change-Id: Ie143ad862b88034ef47470b85fd02c1d040415a7
(cherry picked from commit a9b887b4020431e177fd5f62092ef636a4ec398d)

commit_message:
Tolerate both new and old setuptools

New setuptools 20.2.2 seems to be throwing a new exception
as it uses a vendorized version of packaging now. Let's make
sure our tests works with both the older and newer versions.

Conflicts:
        openstack_requirements/tests/test_requirement.py

NOTE(mriedem): There were a bunch of tests that weren't in kilo.

Change-Id: Iab9247e2026896bb7d25b125788ec3072f819dad
(cherry picked from commit 0cf3c06ad98fa86378ffd561b65c0154989b179c)

commit_message:
Add better validation to cluster shrink

Most cluster strategies need to block certain cluster shrink operations
under some conditions. For example Vertica can easily determine if a
master node has been targetted and should gracefully block this and
notify the operator.

Change-Id: I2fea16cd7eeec81510563daffcea1d2dbdf1eab5
Closes-bug: #1557784

commit_message:
Adjust tooltip position for homepage gauges

This commit changes the tooltip placement for the horizontal gauge
charts on the homepage. Previously they would be rendered to the right
of the charts, but this could easily get cut off and cause a
horizontal scrollbar to appear. Tooltips are now placed above the
charts, and animations have also been disabled to avoid any lag
caused while scrolling or moving over many charts.

Change-Id: I6061fb634002ffefc1dea785621bd098bed32331

commit_message:
Update comments for keystone precision and fernet

Keystone is moving to drop microsecond precision across the board
for consistency. This updates the comments to reflect that the sleep
is not a bug and expected.

Change-Id: I8beaeb4a94f0de1ad5d89df9ec77a1ae1b08a9d1
Closes-Bug: #1517697
Closes-Bug: #1513538
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/97/275497/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # NOTE(morganfainberg): Fernet tokens are not subsecond aware and # Keystone should only be precise to the second. Sleep to ensure # we are passing the second boundry.
deleted_lines: # TODO(lbragstad): Sleeping after the response status has been checked # and the body loaded as JSON allows requests to fail-fast. The sleep # is necessary because keystone will err on the side of security and # invalidate tokens within a small margin of error (within the same # wall clock second) after a revocation event is issued (such as a # password change). Remove this once keystone and Fernet support # sub-second precision.
